message.content:
cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.AI, cs.SI, cs.DS

The paper deals with modeling dependencies among recommended items in a collaborative filtering problem, which is a common task in machine learning and information retrieval. The use of Markov Random Fields (MRFs) is a popular approach in this area, and the paper proposes a novel method for learning sparse MRFs. This makes the paper relevant to several sub-categories of computer science, including machine learning (cs.LG), information retrieval (cs.IR), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), social and information networks (cs.SI), and data structures and algorithms (cs.DS).
